title: Russia faces wave of Islamophobia after Moscow attacks
summary: Since the attack on Crocus City Hall, Central Asian Muslims have been the target of Russian nationalists. Yet the authorities are increasingly in need of migrants, not least because of the war in Ukraine.

title: Israel wants to 'expand' its campaign against Hezbollah
summary: Israeli strikes killed dozens of Syrian soldiers on Friday. Lebanon fears an escalation of the conflict.

title: Romania and Bulgaria join EU Schengen zone for air and sea routes
summary: The two countries joined Sunday, after a 13-year wait. A veto by Austria however means the new status will not apply to land routes after Vienna expressed concerns over a potential influx of asylum seekers.

title: Crews carefully start removing first piece of twisted steel from collapsed Baltimore bridge
summary: The US Coast Guard confirmed Saturday that work has started to remove a section of the toppled structure. The bridge crumpled into the Patapsco River on Tuesday after a massive cargo ship crashed into one of its main supports.

title: In South Africa, Jacob Zuma banned from participating in legislative elections
summary: The Electoral Commission announced on Thursday that Jacob Zuma will not be able to take part in the ballot because of his criminal record. On trial for corruption, the former head of state was the lead candidate for a new party set up to compete with the ANC.

title: Airbnb rentals for the Paris Olympics, sometimes encouraged by property managers, are a source of tension
summary: Assuming many owners will take advantage of the Games to rent out their apartments, property managers are offering partnerships with concierge services and Airbnb. But tensions are growing among residents.

title: Biden wins the North Dakota Democratic primary
summary: The American president's victory was virtually assured, though seven other candidates were on the primary ballot. Former President Donald Trump won the North Dakota Republican Party's March 4 presidential caucuses, taking all 29 delegates.

title: Dutch police arrest man in town of Ede as hostage situation ends
summary: The man was thought to have held four people hostage in a nightclub.

title: UN says four staff wounded in South Lebanon blast
summary: Three United Nations military observers and a translator were taken to hospital for treatment after a shell exploded near them.

title: Poland, Czech Republic warn of Russian interference ahead of European elections
summary: A Moscow-backed network, 'Voice of Europe', was busted by Prague earlier this week. The site reportedly paid MEPs to spread pro-Russian propaganda.

title: One billion meals thrown out every day: 'Food waste exacerbates the climate crisis'
summary: A new UN study found a fifth of the world's food goes to waste. Clementine O'Connor, of the United Nations Environment Programme, says this amount of refuse generates almost 10% of greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Swedish feminist organizations oppose gender self-identification law
summary: A reform proposal aimed at simplifying procedures for changing sex on official documents has provoked opposition from feminist organizations in the country.

title: Paris 2024: Risk of heatwave raises fears of a stifling Games
summary: While it's impossible to predict whether the Paris Olympic Games will coincide with a heatwave, the fact that the competition (July 26-August 11) takes place during the 'climatological peak' means that there's a real threat of a major hot spell.

title: Gaza aid delivery turns deadly after gunfire and stampede, say medics
summary: The Palestine Red Crescent said that at least five people had been killed after thousands gathered for the arrival of trucks of flour and other food on Saturday.

title: Orca's death in Europe's biggest marine park raises questions over animal welfare
summary: Inouk the orca's death is the second in less than six months at Marineland in southern France. A ban on orca shows is set for 2026.

title: Paris Olympics, elections: The threat of increased cyberattacks in 2024 is 'real'
summary: A chief analyst at Mandiant, a company specializing in tracking down and studying elite hacker groups, says major political and cultural events in 2024 represent opportunities for state-sponsored hackers to wreak havoc.

title: Russia moves 5,000 children from Belgorod after Kyiv attacks
summary: The region has been repeatedly targeted by attacks from Ukraine since Russia's invasion in 2022.

title: Goodyear faces a judicial storm
summary: 'The Goodyear affair' (4/4). In the early 2020s, new expert reports put the blame on certain Goodyear tires, which were responsible for numerous truck accidents. Then two whistle-blowers provided Le Monde with internal documents from the company, now under threat from the judiciary.

title: Canada to make contraception for women free
summary: The country will pay for the most widely used methods to avoid pregnancy, such as IUDs, contraceptive pills, hormonal implants or the day-after pill, the Canadian government said Saturday.

title: In Germany, the Social Democratic Party is under attack for its weakness towards Moscow
summary: Criticized within his coalition, Chancellor Olaf Scholz is also accused by several historians of 'denying reality' concerning the threat posed by Russia.

title: 8 dead in car bomb in market in Syria
summary: The explosion occurred on Sunday, in the northern city of Azaz, in Aleppo province, according to the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, which has a network of sources inside Syria.

title: 'After you,' the exquisite politeness of the Chinese chickadee
summary: By flapping her wings, the female of this small passerine invites the male to enter the nesting box first, thus avoiding collisions. But he rarely reciprocates.

title: Beyoncé reclaims country
summary: 'Cowboy Carter', the American singer's eighth album released on Friday, sees her go back to country music's roots.
